body.p:
The Batch Converter script helps you to convert between the following formats:
HTML to DITA
Markdown to DITA
Excel to DITA
Word to DITA
XML to JSON
JSON to XML
HTML to XHTML
Markdown to XHTML
Word to XHTML
HTML to DocBook4 / DocBook5
Markdown to DocBook4 / DocBook5
Word to DocBook4 / DocBook5

This script requires the Oxygen Batch Converter add-on to be installed in the all platforms distribution of . To install the add-on, follow these instructions:
Go on the Oxygen Batch Converter plugin Releases page and download the latest oxygen-batch-converter-{version}-plugin.jar package.
Unzip it inside {oxygenInstallDir}/plugins.Do not create any intermediate folders. Afterwards, the file system should look like this: {oxygenInstallDir}/plugins/oxygen-batch-converter-{version}/plugin.xml

section.title: Arguments for the Batch Converter Script

p.codeblock: sh scripts/batchConverter.sh -i inputFiles -if inputFormat -o outputDirectory -of outputFormat [-ss splitSections]

dlentry.dd: A list of space-separated input files or directories in file syntax form.
The format of the input files. The possible values are: HTML, Markdown, Excel, Word or XML.
The output directory in file syntax form.
The format of the output files. The possible values are: DITA, JSON, XHTML, DocBook4 or DocBook5.

For Word to DITA conversions only, this argument specifies whether or not DITA maps will be created for Word documents that contain multiple sections. The possible values are true or false and the default value is false.
